Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the state of the U.S. steel industry before the tariffs were implemented, suggesting it was "dead" or "going out of business."
Understate: The claim understates the role of the electric arc furnace (EAF) industry, which has been thriving and growing, in contrast to the declining blast furnace industry.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support to prove that the entire U.S. steel industry would be "gone" if Trump had not been elected.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the 25% tariffs on imported steel introduced by Trump are solely responsible for the thriving state of the U.S. steel industry, without considering other factors.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim fails to acknowledge alternative explanations for the increase in steel production, such as improvements and deep cuts in the past, as well as the impact of the Great Recession on production levels.
